TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ResourcePermissionBaseEntry extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines the smallest unit of a code access security permission set.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example inherits from the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBase> class. 4 kinds of constructors are implemented. The example also provides an implementation of a class called `MailslotPermissionEntry`. The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBase.PermissionAccessType%2A> property is then privately set to the type of `MailslotPermissionEntry`. The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBase.TagNames%2A> property is set privately to "Name" and "Machine".
[!code-cpp[ResourcePermissionBase#1](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.security.permis_14_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[ResourcePermissionBase#1](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.security.permis_14_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ResourcePermissionBase#1](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.security.permis_14_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBaseEntry.PermissionAccess%2A> property is set to zero.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 permissionAccess, string[] permissionAccessPath) cil managed

Docs.param: The integer representation of the permission access level enumeration value. The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBaseEntry.PermissionAccess%2A> property is set to this value.
The array of strings that identify the resource you are protecting. The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBaseEntry.PermissionAccessPath%2A> property is set to this value.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified permission access and permission access path.
Gets an integer representation of the access level enumeration value.
Gets an array of strings that identify the resource you are protecting.
Docs.value: An array of strings that identify the resource you are protecting.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterPermissionEntry> has two properties, <xref:System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterPermissionEntry.CategoryName%2A> and <xref:System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterPermissionEntry.MachineName%2A>. The PermissionAccessPath for <xref:System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterPermissionEntry> returns <xref:System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterPermissionEntry.MachineName%2A> + "\\\\" + <xref:System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterPermissionEntry.CategoryName%2A>. For example, "myMachine\\\myCategory".
